Line 97: Line 97:
=== Pepper-spraying incidents===
=== Pepper-spraying incidents===
  +
[[File:Wallst14occupy.jpg|thumb|Protests on 15th day of the occupation]]
On September 24 witnesses said they saw three women collapse on the ground screaming after they were [[pepper spray]]ed in the face. The incident took place near the intersection of 12th Street and [[University Place (Manhattan)|University Place]] in [[Greenwich Village]], during a march between Zuccotti Park and [[Union Square (New York City)|Union Square]]. Officials said that the protestors did not have a permit for the march. A video posted on [[YouTube]] and [[Daily News (New York)|NYDailyNews.com]] shows uniformed officers had corralled the women using orange nets and one suddenly sprayed the women before turning and quickly walking away.<ref>{{cite web|last=Deluca|first=Matt|title=Wall Street protesters cuffed, pepper-sprayed during 'inequality' march|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/2011/09/24/2011-09-24_nasty_wall_streetfight_protesters_cuffed_peppersprayed_during_inequality_march.html?r=news/national|publisher=NYDailyNews.com|accessdate=September 26, 2011}}</ref><ref name=biggerthreats>{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/27/nyregion/wall-street-demonstrations-test-police-trained-for-bigger-threats.html?_r=1 |title=Wall Street Demonstrations Test Police Trained for Bigger Threats |last=Goldstein |first=Joseph |work=The New York Times |date=September 26, 2011 |accessdate=October 3, 2011}}</ref> Activists later published the name and contact details of the officer seen spraying the women with pepper spray, and encouraged members of the public to complain about his conduct.<ref>{{cite web|author=Karen McVeigh in New York |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/sep/26/occupy-wall-street-police-named |title=Occupy Wall Street activists name officer over pepper spray incident | World news | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=September 27, 2011}}</ref> The police officer who used the pepper spray was identified<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-27080_3-20111813-245/anonymous-exposes-info-of-alleged-pepper-spray-cop/|title=Anonymous exposes info of alleged pepper spray cop|author=Elinor Mills|publisher=CNet News|date=2011-09-26}}</ref> as [[Anthony Bologna|Anthony V. Bologna]] a [[Inspector#Municipal police|Deputy Inspector]] of the New York Police Department.<ref name="Bologna UK Guardian story">{{cite news|last=McVeigh|first=Karen|title=Occupy Wall Street: 'Pepper-spray' officer named in Bush protest claim |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/sep/27/occupy-wall-street-anthony-bologna|publisher=The Guardian|work=[[The Guardian (UK)]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna New York Times story">{{cite news|last=Dwyer|first=Jim|title=A Spray Like a Punch in the Face |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/28/nyregion/a-burst-of-pepper-spray-like-a-punch-in-the-face.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna New York Magazine story">{{cite news|last=Coscarelli|first=Joe|title=Anonymous Outs NYPD Officer Who Pepper-Sprayed Occupy Wall Street Protesters |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2011/09/anonymous_outs_nypd_officer_wh.html|work=[[New York Magazine]]|date=September 26, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna Huffington Post story">{{cite news|title=Anthony Bologna, NYPD Officer Who Pepper-Sprayed Protester, Had Role In 2004 Incidents |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/27/anthony-bologna-nypd-officer_n_983708.html|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna CBS News story">{{cite news|title=Hackers grab Goldman CEO's personal data |http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/09/27/tech/cnettechnews/main20112427.shtml?tag=mncol;lst;1|work=[[CBS News]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna UPI story">{{cite news|title=Michael Moore backs Wall Street activists |url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2011/09/27/Michael-Moore-backs-Wall-Street-activists/UPI-94271317110400/|work=[[UPI]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref> Bologna was appointed C.O. of New York's First Precinct in 2005,<ref name=bologna-bio>{{cite web|url=http://www.thevillager.com/villager_113/afteryearsoftrouble.html |title=After years of trouble-shooting, he gets a precinct |last=Amateau |first=Albert |work=The Villager |date=July 5, 2005 |accessdate=October 3, 2011}}</ref> and previously faced civil rights complaints for his role during the 2004 Republican Convention held in New York City, for allegedly committing false arrest and civil rights violations.<ref name="Bologna UK Guardian story" /><ref name="Bologna Huffington Post story" />
On September 24 witnesses said they saw three women collapse on the ground screaming after they were [[pepper spray]]ed in the face. The incident took place near the intersection of 12th Street and [[University Place (Manhattan)|University Place]] in [[Greenwich Village]], during a march between Zuccotti Park and [[Union Square (New York City)|Union Square]]. Officials said that the protestors did not have a permit for the march. A video posted on [[YouTube]] and [[Daily News (New York)|NYDailyNews.com]] shows uniformed officers had corralled the women using orange nets and one suddenly sprayed the women before turning and quickly walking away.<ref>{{cite web|last=Deluca|first=Matt|title=Wall Street protesters cuffed, pepper-sprayed during 'inequality' march|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/2011/09/24/2011-09-24_nasty_wall_streetfight_protesters_cuffed_peppersprayed_during_inequality_march.html?r=news/national|publisher=NYDailyNews.com|accessdate=September 26, 2011}}</ref><ref name=biggerthreats>{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/27/nyregion/wall-street-demonstrations-test-police-trained-for-bigger-threats.html?_r=1 |title=Wall Street Demonstrations Test Police Trained for Bigger Threats |last=Goldstein |first=Joseph |work=The New York Times |date=September 26, 2011 |accessdate=October 3, 2011}}</ref> Activists later published the name and contact details of the officer seen spraying the women with pepper spray, and encouraged members of the public to complain about his conduct.<ref>{{cite web|author=Karen McVeigh in New York |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/sep/26/occupy-wall-street-police-named |title=Occupy Wall Street activists name officer over pepper spray incident | World news | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=September 27, 2011}}</ref> The police officer who used the pepper spray was identified<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-27080_3-20111813-245/anonymous-exposes-info-of-alleged-pepper-spray-cop/|title=Anonymous exposes info of alleged pepper spray cop|author=Elinor Mills|publisher=CNet News|date=2011-09-26}}</ref> as [[Anthony Bologna|Anthony V. 'Pepper-spray' officer named in Bush protest claim |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/sep/27/occupy-wall-street-anthony-bologna|publisher=The Guardian|work=[[The Guardian (UK)]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna New York Times story">{{cite news|last=Dwyer|first=Jim|title=A Spray Like a Punch in the Face |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/28/nyregion/a-burst-of-pepper-spray-like-a-punch-in-the-face.html|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna New York Magazine story">{{cite news|last=Coscarelli|first=Joe|title=Anonymous Outs NYPD Officer Who Pepper-Sprayed Occupy Wall Street Protesters |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2011/09/anonymous_outs_nypd_officer_wh.html|work=[[New York Magazine]]|date=September 26, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna Huffington Post story">{{cite Huffington Post]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna CBS News story">{{cite news|title=Hackers grab Goldman CEO's personal data |http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/09/27/tech/cnettechnews/main20112427.shtml?tag=mncol;lst;1|work=[[CBS News]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Bologna UPI story">{{cite news|title=Michael Moore backs Wall Street activists |url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2011/09/27/Michael-Moore-backs-Wall-Street-activists/UPI-94271317110400/|work=[[UPI]]|date=September 27, 2011}}</ref> Bologna was appointed C.O. of New York's First Precinct in 2005,<ref name=bologna-bio>{{cite web|url=http://www.thevillager.com/villager_113/afteryearsoftrouble.html |title=After years of trouble-shooting, he gets a precinct |last=Amateau |first=Albert |work=The Villager |date=July 5, 2005 |accessdate=October 3, 2011}}</ref> and previously faced civil rights complaints for his role during the 2004 Republican Convention held in New York City, for allegedly committing false arrest and civil rights violations.<ref name="Bologna UK Guardian story" /><ref name="Bologna Huffington Post story" />
Another woman who had been caught up in the net and pepper sprayed reported other incidents that she believed to be unnecessary use of police force.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mansfield|first=Jeanne|title=Why I Was Maced at the Wall Street Protests|url=http://bostonreview.net/BR36.5/jeanne_mansfield_occupy_wall_street.php|publisher=''[[Boston Review]]''|date=26 September 2011 |accessdate=30 September 2011}}</ref> Responding to the allegations, one police official said that Officer Bologna was not aiming at the female protestors, but rather at male protestors who he believed were pushing officers and causing a confrontation that put officers at risk of injury.<ref name=peppersprayinvestigate>{{cite web|url=http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/09/28/police-department-to-examine-pepper-spray-incident/|title=Officer's Pepper-Spraying of Protesters Is Under Investigation|publisher=TheNewYorkTimes.com|first1=Al|last1=Baker|first2=Joseph|last2=Goldstein|date=28 September 2011|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref><ref name="nytimes">{{cite news|last=Goldstein|first=Joseph|title=Videos Show Police Using Pepper Spray at Protest on the Financial System|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/26/nyregion/videos-show-police-using-pepper-spray-at-protest.html?_r=1&adxnnl=1&adxnnlx=1317054152-l5F2G5o5L08fMR9ja+iE4A|publisher=''The New York Times''|accessdate=September 26, 2011}}</ref> The Police Departmentâs chief spokesman, Paul J. Browne, said the police had used the pepper spray âappropriately." According to the spokesperson, âPepper spray was used once after individuals confronted officers and tried to prevent them from deploying a mesh barrierâsomething that was edited out or otherwise not captured in the video.â<ref name="nytimes" />
Another woman who had been caught up in the net and pepper sprayed reported other incidents that she believed to be unnecessary use of police force.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mansfield|first=Jeanne|title=Why I Was Maced at the Wall Street Protests|url=http://bostonreview.net/BR36.5/jeanne_mansfield_occupy_wall_street.php|publisher=''[[Boston Review]]''|date=26 September 2011 |accessdate=30 September 2011}}</ref> Responding to the allegations, one police official said that Officer Bologna was not aiming at the female protestors, but rather at male protestors who he believed were pushing officers and causing a confrontation that put officers at risk of injury.<ref name=peppersprayinvestigate>{{cite web|url=http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/09/28/police-department-to-examine-pepper-spray-incident/|title=Officer's Pepper-Spraying of Protesters Is Under Investigation|publisher=TheNewYorkTimes.com|first1=Al|last1=Baker|first2=Joseph|last2=Goldstein|date=28 September 2011|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref><ref name="nytimes">{{cite news|last=Goldstein|first=Joseph|title=Videos Show Police Using Pepper Spray at Protest on the Financial System|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/26/nyregion/videos-show-police-using-pepper-spray-at-protest.html?_r=1&adxnnl=1&adxnnlx=1317054152-l5F2G5o5L08fMR9ja+iE4A|publisher=''The New York Times''|accessdate=September 26, 2011}}</ref> The Police Departmentâs chief spokesman, Paul J. Browne, said the police had used the pepper spray âappropriately." According to the spokesperson, âPepper spray was used once after individuals confronted officers and tried to prevent them from deploying a mesh barrierâsomething that was edited out or otherwise not captured in the video.â<ref name="nytimes" />
â   â
[[Image:Wallst14occupy.jpg|thumb|Protests on 15th day of the occupation]]
 
A second video posted on the political blog [[Daily Kos]] appeared to show another pepper spraying incident. According to the photographer, who was wearing his press card, he had been on East 12th Street and saw officers drag a woman from behind a net and throw her on the ground. He photographed the scene and then started walking away when he was sprayed. The photographer said that he was not sure who had sprayed him.<ref name="peppersprayinvestigate" />
A second video posted on the political blog [[Daily Kos]] appeared to show another pepper spraying incident. According to the photographer, who was wearing his press card, he had been on East 12th Street and saw officers drag a woman from behind a net and throw her on the ground. He photographed the scene and then started walking away when he was sprayed. The photographer said that he was not sure who had sprayed him.<ref name="peppersprayinvestigate" />
